literal_meaning: To throw water into the sea.
example: Trying to convince him is like echar agua al mar; he won’t change his mind.

figurative_meaning: It's better to do something late than not at all.
example: He finally apologized; más vale tarde que nunca.

idiom: No hay mal que por bien no venga
literal_meaning: There is no bad from which good does not come.
figurative_meaning: Every cloud has a silver lining.
example: Losing that job led him to a better opportunity; no hay mal que por bien no venga.

idiom: A caballo regalado no se le mira el diente
literal_meaning: Don't look at the teeth of a gifted horse.
example: You should be grateful for the help; a caballo regalado no se le mira el diente.

idiom: El que mucho abarca poco aprieta
literal_meaning: He who grasps too much holds little tightly.
figurative_meaning: If you try to do too much, you may achieve little.
example: He needs to focus on one project; el que mucho abarca poco aprieta.

idiom: Camarón que se duerme se lo lleva la corriente
literal_meaning: The shrimp that falls asleep is carried away by the current.
figurative_meaning: You must stay alert to avoid losing opportunities.
example: If you don’t pay attention, you’ll miss your chance; camarón que se duerme se lo lleva la corriente.

literal_meaning: In bad times, put on a good face.
example: Even though things are tough, remember: a mal tiempo, buena cara.

idiom: Dime con quién andas y te diré quién eres
literal_meaning: Tell me who you walk with and I will tell you who you are.
example: Be careful with your friends; dime con quién andas y te diré quién eres.

idiom: El pez por la boca muere
literal_meaning: The fish dies by its mouth.
figurative_meaning: Be careful what you say; it can lead to trouble.
example: He got in trouble for his comments; el pez por la boca muere.

idiom: Cuando el río suena, agua lleva
literal_meaning: When the river sounds, it carries water.
figurative_meaning: There’s usually some truth behind rumors.
example: If people are talking, there must be something true; cuando el río suena, agua lleva.
